titleStmt.title: Here begynneth the first volum of sir Iohan Froyssart of the cronycles of Englande, Fraunce, Spayne, Portyngale, Scotlande, Bretayne, Flau[n]ders: and other places adioynynge. Tra[n]slated out of frenche into our maternall englysshe tonge, by Iohan Bourchier knight lorde Berners: at the co[m]maundement of oure moost highe redouted souerayne lorde kyng Henry the. viii. kyng of Englande and of Fraunce, [and] highe defender of the christen faythe. [et]c.
Chroniques. Book 1-2. English
titleStmt.author: Froissart, Jean, 1338?-1410?
Berners, John Bourchier, Lord, 1466 or 7-1533.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Fletestrete by Richarde Pynson, printer to the kynges noble grace,
publicationStmt.date: And ended the. xxviii. day of Ianuary: the yere of our lorde. M.D.xxxiii. [1523]

notesStmt.note: A translation of books 1 and 2 of the "Chroniques".
In this edition, b1r col. 2 line 3 from bottom ends "kyng in his be-"; b2r col. 1 line 1 has "litell hakeneys/".
Copies may exist with some sheets in a reprint by Richard Redman, ca. 1535--see STC.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library and the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 43 (British Library copy) and at reel 925 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy).
